summary: The client shared a terminal error indicating a Supabase initialization failure when starting the BrightHR Lite Vision app, due to missing configuration for local SQLite mode. Mike diagnosed the issue, provided manual fix steps, and proposed Sprint SP-003 to enforce local SQLite setup, conditionalize Supabase, and enable testing of user stories like login and employee search.

decisions.title: Propose Sprint SP-003 for Local Setup Fix
decisions.details: Targeted sprint to re-execute US-016 for SQLite-only mode, add conditional guards in app.py, seed test data, and integrate with US-010 for end-to-end testing, aligning with Phase 1 Vision.

actions.task: Try manual fix steps: Create .env with SQLite config, patch app.py to conditionalize Supabase, install SQLAlchemy if needed, seed test data, and run the app to test login and search.
Await approval for SP-003; if approved, execute sprint to generate updated code, update backlog statuses, and ensure app runs locally without Supabase dependencies.

backlog_deltas.title: Local SQLite Setup Fix & Integration Test (re-execute US-016, NFR-001, US-010; optional US-001)

risks.risk: App crashes on startup preventing testing of core features like login (US-010) and employee search (US-001).
risks.mitigation: Implement conditional Supabase initialization in app.py and enforce SQLite via setup script (US-016) to enable local mode without cloud dependencies.

risks.risk: Future sprints regress to Supabase defaults, introducing setup complexity or costs misaligned with Phase 1 Vision.
risks.mitigation: Document local-only mode in backlog and code comments; re-execute setup in SP-003 to lock in SQLite configuration.
